area_name: Old Standard aka the Leaning Crack Boulder

content.description:
This boulder problem has the crux right in the beginning.  It start by grabbing two side crimpers.  The feet are very scarce, but they are ok.  Keep your balance.  I do not know if I did the first ascent or not but I named it Rain Chaser because while doing my sent the rain was chasing me little by little until it pour on me at the top of the boulder.   

  If anyone has done this before I will gladly change the name and the first ascent information.
content.location: This is climber's right of the Leaning crack (V4) of the main bathroom boulder.

content.description:
Classic diagonal crack traverse 

mountainproject.com/v/jared… Until I upload from my home computer.
content.location: The classic left-leaning crack(V2/3) and sit-start dihedral(V/3) are just past the bathrooms and right about 25 yards(there are also some slabs and other faces there

content.description: Short hand crack / stemming problem in the corner.
content.location: In the corner left of the leaning crack.

content.description: Contrived but quality compression problem, using the right face of the crack found around the corner from the Leaning Crack. Start low with left hand on a small crimp inside the crack and the right hand on the sloping arete. Work up heel hooks with the right foot, the sloped arete with the right hand, and small crimps inside the crack with the left hand. A technical mantle secures the top.
content.location: 8 feet left of the leaning crack, find a hand crack in a corner. climb the right-hand face, using compression and avoiding stemming out to the left-hand face.

content.description: A high quality boulder with a prominent arching crack on the south side of the boulder.
